reviewText: I remember playing this game as a kid, I absolutely loved the simple gameplay and how it just felt. Playing it now, it might be a little more dull or a little easier (okay, a lot easier, took me an hour to get millions of dollars) but the nostalgia alone made me still really like this game. I can't do a pro/con on this because it just doesn't feel right. This is a very fun game, the other two are fun also, definitely worth it for the small amount of money it cost.

reviewText:
The first Tradewinds that ever came out gives you the experience of what it would be like to be a merchant. Tradewinds 2 However still gives you the same chances and opportunities of being a merchant, however it becomes alot harder, as it gives you storylines to follow, and revoking the ability to make a fleet. Tradewinds Legends gives you back the fleet options however it limits your ship count to 8. Tradewinds Caravans gives you the opportunity to become a merchant that walks the silk road, your caravan count can only be a maximum of 15. Tradewinds Odyssey gives you the tradewinds experience inside of greek mythology.

Tradewinds, Tradewinds 2, and Tradewinds Legends, come as a bundle for a price of $4.99

Tradewinds Caravans, and Tradewinds Odyssey, being newer games come in a seperate bundle of $14.99

reviewText: Tradewinds is considered to be one of my favorites and childhood games. So many adventures just traveling all over the map doing quests and bounties hunts while building wealth from trading. The game itself is simple. It's such a good game to waste your time. From the start of the series to the third (as this pack only contains Classics to Legends), more interesting features are added in each game such as port battles and flying. First game has no story for each character, but in the second and third there are stories which you play and resolve their conflicts.\n\nI suggest buying if you're bored. It may be too short but it's a good waste of time :DD
voteText: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Highly addictive trade and bounty hunt game, gain more money, buy more ships, more cannons, become more powerful, buy more supplies to sell, put money in a bank for safe keeping, take a loan to get started, rent a warehouse to store supplies, go to the pub for info, hand in wanted pirates, even dabble in some highly profitable and highly risky drug dealings. This game is a 90s gem!\n\n8.5/10
Way old but enjoyable if you want to waste a few hours.

reviewText: Addictive ship trading Sim. So simple, yet leaves you with a satisfying gameplay experience.
This game will make you so mad.

I remember playing the original Tradewinds a lot in middle school. I'm a lot better at trading now than I was then. Worse at combat though. Meh.\nDefinitely good for killing a few hours if you can figure out the combat. It feels a bit poorly balanced to me but I'm probably just not trying hard enough whoops
